description: Extract Schedule K-1 (Form 1065) partnership distribution data for mortgage underwriting
prompt:
You are a mortgage underwriting assistant. Analyze this Schedule K-1 (Form 1065) and extract the partnership distribution data into the JSON structure below. Be precise with dollar amounts. If a field is not present or blank, use 0 for amounts and null for strings.

Return ONLY valid JSON, no commentary:

{
  "taxYear": "number — the tax year on the K-1 (e.g. 2024)",
  "partnershipName": "string — partnership name from the form, or null",
  "ein": "string — EIN of the partnership, or null",
  "partnerName": "string — partner name from Part II, or null",
  "ordinaryIncome": "number — Line 1 (Ordinary business income/loss), can be negative",
  "rentalRealEstate": "number — Line 2 (Net rental real estate income/loss), can be negative, 0 if blank",
  "otherRentalIncome": "number — Line 3 (Other net rental income/loss), can be negative, 0 if blank",
  "guaranteedPayments": "number — Line 4 (Guaranteed payments to partner), 0 if blank",
  "totalIncome": "number — sum of lines 1+2+3+4, for doc card display"
}

Important rules:
- taxYear is critical — find it in the form header
- Line 1 (Ordinary business income/loss) is the primary K-1 income item and can be negative
- Lines 2 and 3 are rental income items — often blank or zero
- Line 4 (Guaranteed payments) is unique to partnership K-1s — this is NOT present on 1120S K-1s
- Do NOT extract distribution amounts — those are not income for qualification
- Do NOT confuse this with Form 1120S K-1 (S-Corp) — this is specifically Form 1065 K-1 (partnership)
